<gmd:abstract>             <gco:CharacterString>The National Digital Forecast Database (NDFD) contains a seamless mosaic of the National Weather Service's (NWS) digital forecasts of air temperature. In collaboration with NWS National Centers for Environmental Prediction (NCEP) and NWS Weather Forecast Offices (WFO), the central NDFD server ingests 5-km, 2-dimensional grids of air temperature, and creates experimental forecast data mosaics for the coterminous United States (CONUS), Alaska, Hawaii, and Guam.</gco:CharacterString>          </gmd:abstract>          <gmd:purpose>             <gco:CharacterString>The National Coastal Data Development Center (NCDDC) accesses this database once daily to get the 24hr forecast for air temperatures. This information is being made available in the near realtime application of the Harmful Algal Blooms Observing System as an environmental data layer that may affect the spread of these blooms.</gco:CharacterString>          </gmd:purpose>          <gmd:credit>             <gco:CharacterString>National Weather Service</gco:CharacterString>          </gmd:credit>          <gmd:status> <gmd:description>                         <gco:CharacterString>The National Digital Forecast Database (NDFD) ftp server is accessed once daily by the National Coastal Data Development Center. Air temperature forecasts for the United States are downloaded from this server. Data from the NDFD are provided in GRIB, Edition 2 (WMO 2001) format. The National Weather Service provides decoding software that will convert data into ESRI shapefile format. This decoding program is run at the National Coastal Data Development Center (NCDDC). This software has been slightly modified by the National Coastal Data Development Center in order to capture the date of the forecast as a field within the generated shapefile. The resulting shapefiles are loaded as ArcSDE layers and stored at NCDDC.</gco:CharacterString>                      </gmd:description>                      <gmd:dateTime gco:nilReason="unknown"/>
